attributes.action: End racist abuse on social media platforms and prosecute people who post abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Racist abuse or and other type of bullying has no place on social media. It needs to end
attributes.background: Meet with social media companies to agree on how they will tackle this issue.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Produce and enforce a zero-tolerance strategy to end racism on social media: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/591720

Require social media platforms’ terms of use to prohibit racism and hate speech: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/591760

Increase legal penalties for those convicted of online racial abuse: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/591776

Require Social media sites review every post/comment before publication: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/582820

Decisions about prosecuting individuals for any offences relating to online abuse would be a matter for the Crown Prosecution Service, not the Government or House of Commons.
